citations.narrative:
At approximately 1:30 pm on 8/3/2024, a young girl was bitten on the arm by a capybara. At the time of the incident there
was no barrier fence separating the public form the capybara’s enclosure. Further, no attendant was present by the
capybara’s primary enclosure at the time of the incident and the location of the incident could not be viewed by the
available surveillance cameras. This illustrates that there was insufficient distance between the capybara and the general
viewing public to assure the safety of the pubic and the animal.
During public exhibitions animals must be handled to minimize the risk of harm to the animals and the public. This can be
accomplished by the use of barriers or other means of ensuring distance between the public and the animals on exhibit.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
CARRIE BONGARD, ANIMAL CARE INSPECTOR n
